definition: disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
deficiency of kidney essence due to sexual excess (TCM)

(TCM) "five strains and seven impairments", five referring to the five viscera 五臟|五脏[wu3 zang4], and seven to adverse effects on one's body as a result of: overeating (spleen), anger (liver), moisture (kidney), cold (lung), worry (heart), wind and rain (outer appearance) and fear (mind)
condition characterized by thirst, hunger, frequent urination and weight loss, identified in TCM with type 2 diabetes
localized pain disorder (in Chinese medicine)/arthralgia syndrome/bi disorder
